qas.question: What statutory policy minimizes outward expansion of urban London?
Greater London is divided into what two groups of boroughs?
Where is the centre of London said to be located?

answers.text: Eleanor Cross at Charing Cross near the junction of Trafalgar Square and Whitehall

qas.question: In which directions does the River Thames divide the City of London?
What metropolitan area lies beyond the Metropolitan Green Belt?

context: Outward urban expansion is now prevented by <a0_0>the Metropolitan Green Belt<a0_0/>, although the built-up area extends beyond the boundary in places, resulting in a separately defined Greater London Urban Area. Beyond this is the vast <a4_0>London commuter belt<a4_0/>. Greater London is split for some purposes into <a1_0>Inner London and Outer London<a1_0/>. The city is split by the River Thames into <a3_0>North and South<a3_0/>, with an informal central London area in its interior. The coordinates of the nominal centre of London, traditionally considered to be the original <a2_0>Eleanor Cross at Charing Cross near the junction of Trafalgar Square and Whitehall<a2_0/>, are approximately 51°30′26″N 00°07′39″W﻿ / ﻿51.50722°N 0.12750°W﻿ / 51.50722; -0.12750.
